name: Classic Fish Ceviche
description: Fresh fish marinated in lime juice, with red onion, aji limo, and served with sweet potato and corn.
instructions: Slice the fish thinly and place in a bowl. Add the lime juice, red onion slices, and aji limo (or aji amarillo). Marinate for 15-20 minutes. Serve immediately with slices of sweet potato and corn.

name: Lomo Saltado
description: Stir-fry beef, tomatoes, onions, and yellow Peruvian chili, served with French fries and rice. A Chifa classic.
instructions: Marinate the beef with salt, pepper, and soy sauce. In a wok or large pan, heat oil until smoking. Sear the beef quickly, then add onions, tomatoes, and chili. Deglaze with vinegar and more soy sauce. Serve immediately over French fries, with a side of rice.

name: Causa Rellena
description: Mashed yellow potato seasoned with lime and aji amarillo, layered with tuna or chicken salad.
instructions: Boil and mash the yellow potatoes. Mix the mash with Aji Amarillo paste and lime juice. For the filling, mix shredded protein with mayonnaise. Layer the potato mash, the filling, and sliced avocado in a mold. Chill before serving.

name: Pachamanca
description: Meat (beef, pork, chicken) marinated in Peruvian spices, cooked with potatoes and sweet potatoes.
instructions: Marinate the meat in the spice mixture and Chicha de Jora overnight. Layer the meats, potatoes, and vegetables in a large pot. Cook slowly over low heat or (traditionally) buried in hot stones. Requires long, slow cooking.

name: Juane de Gallina
description: Rice, chicken, olives, and egg wrapped and cooked in bijao leaves. A classic dish from the Amazon.
instructions: Cook the rice with turmeric for color. Prepare a chicken stew. Mix the rice with the stew broth and fillings. Wrap the rice and a piece of chicken in the bijao leaf to form a pouch. Boil the pouches in water for 60 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Suspiro a la Limeña
description: A rich dulce de leche base topped with a meringue flavored with port wine and cinnamon.
instructions: Prepare the manjar blanco (dulce de leche) by cooking the milks and egg yolks until thick. Pour into serving glasses. For the meringue, boil the port wine and sugar to make a syrup, then whip the egg whites while slowly pouring in the hot syrup. Top the manjar blanco with meringue and sprinkle with cinnamon.

name: Papa a la Huancaína
description: Boiled yellow potatoes covered in a creamy sauce made from Queso Fresco, Aji Amarillo, and crackers.
ingredients: Hard-boiled egg and olives for garnish
instructions: Boil the potatoes and slice them. Blend the cheese, Aji Amarillo, evaporated milk, and crackers until the sauce is smooth and creamy. Arrange the potato slices on a plate, pour the Huancaína sauce over them, and garnish with egg and olives.

name: Quinoa Soup
description: A hearty and healthy soup made with quinoa, vegetables, and chicken or beef broth.
instructions: Rinse the quinoa thoroughly. In a pot, sauté the vegetables. Add the broth and the rinsed quinoa. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the quinoa and vegetables are tender (about 30 minutes). Season and serve hot, garnished with cilantro.

name: Pisco Sour
description: Peru's national cocktail, made with Pisco, lime juice, egg white, and Angostura bitters.
instructions: In a blender or cocktail shaker, combine Pisco, lime juice, syrup, and egg white. Blend or shake briefly with ice until frothy. Strain into a glass and top with a dash of Angostura bitters.

name: Patarashca (Fish in Banana Leaf)
description: Fish marinated in regional spices, wrapped in a plantain leaf and grilled over fire.
instructions: Marinate the fish fillet with spices, chopped onion, and chili. Wrap the marinated fish tightly in a plantain or bijao leaf. Grill the wrapped fish over medium-high heat for about 15 minutes per side until cooked through.

name: Rice with Chicken (Arroz con Pollo)
description: Chicken and rice cooked together in cilantro and Peruvian dark beer, giving it a green color.
ingredients: Chicha de Jora or dark beer
instructions: Sauté a mixture of blended cilantro, onion, and spices. Add chicken pieces and sear. Add the rice, broth, and dark beer/chicha. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed (about 20 minutes).

name: Stuffed Rocoto (Rocoto Relleno)
description: Spicy rocoto peppers stuffed with seasoned ground beef and topped with melted cheese.
instructions: Blanch the rocotos several times to reduce spiciness. Prepare the seasoned ground beef filling with eggs and olives. Stuff the peppers with the filling, cover with a slice of cheese, and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with a slice of potato.

name: Picarones (Peruvian Doughnuts)
description: Peruvian donuts made from squash and sweet potato, drizzled with fig honey (miel de chancaca).
instructions: Mash the squash and sweet potato and mix with the yeast and flour to form a dough. Let the dough rise. Shape the dough into rings and deep-fry until golden brown. Prepare the honey syrup by boiling chancaca with orange peel and cinnamon. Drizzle the hot syrup over the picarones.

name: Tiradito (Peruvian Sashimi)
description: A sashimi-like dish of sliced raw fish, served with a spicy cream sauce (aji amarillo or rocoto).
instructions: Slice the fish very thinly (like sashimi). Arrange the slices on a chilled plate. Blend the lime juice with the chili paste, cilantro, and salt to create the sauce. Pour the sauce immediately over the fish and serve.

name: Fried Plantain
description: Fried sweet plantains, a common side dish or appetizer in the Amazon region.
instructions: Peel the plantains and slice them diagonally. Heat the vegetable oil in a pan. Fry the plantain slices on both sides until they are golden brown and caramelized. Drain excess oil and serve hot.

name: Seco de Cordero (Lamb Stew)
description: Lamb stew seasoned with cilantro, aji panca, and chicha de jora (fermented corn beverage).
instructions: Brown the lamb pieces. Sauté the onions, cilantro, Aji Panca, and spices to form a base. Add the lamb and cover with Chicha de Jora and water. Simmer covered for at least 2 hours until the lamb is tender. Serve with rice and beans.
